means: （用于初次见面握手时）很高兴认识您

sentence.Network_en: I'm always pleased to try out a new variety.
sentence.Network_cn: 我一直乐于尝试新产品。

sentence.Network_en: Drake and his cohorts were not pleased with my appointment.
sentence.Network_cn: 德雷克那一帮人对我的任命很不满。

sentence.Network_en: He pretended to be affronted, but inwardly he was pleased.
sentence.Network_cn: 他假装受到了冒犯，但其实内心很高兴。

jx.jx_en_mean: said on being introduced to someone
jx.jx_cn_mean: [用于被人介绍时]见到你很高兴

lj.lj_ly: ‘This is my wife.’ ‘Pleased to meet you.’.

encyclopedia.content: pleased 英[pli:zd]美[plizd] a. 1.高兴的，喜欢的；满意的(+at/about/by/with)[+to-v][+that] a. 1.高兴的，喜欢的；满意的(+at/about/by/with)[+to-v][+that] 时 态：pleased,pleasing,pleases 名 词：pleas'er 同反义词 参考例句 Thank you for your letter of May 26. I shall be pleased to enroll in your graduate School provided that my request for financial support is accepted. 感谢你5月26日来信，如果我对经济资

entry.def: If you are pleased, you are happy about something or satisfied with something.

example.ex: Felicity seemed pleased at the suggestion...
example.tran: 费莉西蒂好像对这个建议很满意。

example.ex: I think he's going to be pleased that we identified the real problems...
example.tran: 我想他会为我们发现了真正的问题而感到高兴的。

entry.def: If you say you will be pleased to do something, you are saying in a polite way that you are willing to do it.

example.ex: We will be pleased to answer any questions you may have...
example.tran: 我们将很乐意回答你们可能想问的任何问题。

example.ex: I shall be very pleased to help you in every way I can.
example.tran: 我将很高兴地尽我所能来帮助你。

entry.def: You can tell someone that you are pleased with something they have done in order to express your approval.

example.ex: I'm pleased with the way things have been going...
I am very pleased about the result...

entry.def: If someone is not too pleased or is none too pleased, they are annoyed about something or do not think something is acceptable.

example.ex: I was not too pleased with the record you sent me...
example.tran: 我对你寄给我的唱片不太满意。

example.ex: He's not too pleased that I don't seem to be doing my bit...
example.tran: 他对我好像没有做我该做的而感到不满意。

entry.def: When you are about to give someone some news which you know will please them, you can say that you are pleased to tell them the news or that they will be pleased to hear it.

example.ex: I'm pleased to say that he is now doing well...
example.tran: 我很高兴地说，他现在一切都好。

example.ex: You'll be very pleased to know that we offered help immediately.
example.tran: 你会很高兴地知道我们立即给予了帮助。

entry.tran: （用于正式信函中）意欲（做…）的，决意（做…）的
entry.def: In official letters, people often say they will be pleased to do something, as a polite way of introducing what they are going to do or inviting people to do something.

example.ex: We will be pleased to delete the charge from the original invoice...
example.tran: 我们决定将这笔费用从原始发票上删去。

example.ex: We are always pleased to hear from our customers.
example.tran: 我们不论何时都欢迎顾客来信。

entry.tran: 对自己满意；（尤指）自鸣得意，飘飘然
entry.def: If someone seems very satisfied with something they have done, you can say that they are pleased with themselves, especially if you think they are more satisfied than they should be.

example.ex: He was pleased with himself for having remembered her name...
example.tran: 他为自己记住了她的名字得意起来。

example.ex: He had reason to be pleased with himself, since he was one of only seven out of forty candidates who were successful.
example.tran: 他有理由沾沾自喜，因为他是40个候选人里仅有的7名成功者之一。

entry.tran: 见到你很高兴；幸会；认识你很高兴
entry.def: You can say 'Pleased to meet you' as a polite way of greeting someone who you are meeting for the first time.

means.word_mean: 2. feeling pleasurable satisfaction over something by which you measures your self-worth;

auth_sentence.content: I'm really pleased to be starting this column.
auth_sentence.res_content: I'm really pleased to be starting this column.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I'm really pleased to be starting this column.

auth_sentence.content: In fact, he sounded rather pleased with it.
auth_sentence.res_content: In fact, he sounded rather pleased with it.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In fact, he sounded rather pleased with it.

auth_sentence.content: But afterward her sons were pleased, she says.
auth_sentence.res_content: But afterward her sons were pleased, she says.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But afterward her sons were pleased, she says.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 令人愉快的, 舒适的
stems_affixes.word_buile: pleas愉快,高兴+ant表形容词→adj.令人愉快的, 舒适的
pleas愉快,高兴+e→满足的,高兴的
pleas愉快,高兴+ed表形容词→adj.高兴的, 满足的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 愉快, 快乐, 乐事
stems_affixes.word_buile: pleas愉快,高兴+ure表名词→n.愉快, 快乐, 乐事
dis不+please[adj.满足的,高兴的 v.请]→v.使不快, 使[人]生气
pleas愉快,高兴+e→满足的,高兴的

Sentence.sentence: You can pretend that you don't like things which you are actually quite pleased about.

sentences.en: Unfortunately George cannot be with us today so I am pleased to accept this award on his behalf.
sentences.cn: 不幸的是乔治今天不能来了,故而我很荣幸能替他领奖。

means.word_mean: (用于初次见面握手时)很高兴认识您

sentences.en: ‘John, this is Dr Savary.’ ‘I’m pleased to meet you.’
sentences.cn: “约翰，这是萨瓦里博士。”“很高兴认识您。”

sentences.en: She was none too pleased at having to do it all again.
sentences.cn: 只能全部重做，这使她很气愤。

means.word_mean: 十分情愿，巴不得(做某事)

sentences.en: We’re only too pleased to help.
My brother was as pleased as Punch when he passed his driving test.
sentences.cn: 我哥哥通过驾驶考试后得意万分。

sentences.en: He was looking very pleased with himself.
